Title: the helium insufficiency

Sheldon: Leonard, I’ve got terrible news.
Before I tell you, perhaps I should soften the blow. You’re face is pleasingly symmetrical.
A Swedish team of physicists is trying to scoop our super-fluid vortex experiment.
That kind of stinks? Why aren’t you more upset? Did I soften the blow too much? Because this here is more like a Picasso painting.
Perform the experiment immediately.
A month? What? Are you kidding me? That would have been a good time for you to soften the blow.
Thank you. Aren’t you sweet.
Did you know that I almost didn’t wear this shirt today?
But you won’t need much for that.
Not a chance.
He said be honest, so I was honest. Didn’t your mother tell you? It’s the best policy. So, what do you say?
He could’ve softened the blow.
Leonard, if that Swedish team beats us, I will never be able to enjoy anything from their country again. Which is a shame, because Swedish meatballs are my favourite toothpick-delivered meatball.
Where does he work?
How many questions are too many questions?
Four questions. There answer’s four.
What’s he say?
That’s right. And what did he do?
It’s like it was yesterday.
Of course I do. I don’t want that Swedish team scooping us.
Leonard, wait. This is highly unethical.
Was she helping him with his research?
Well, but where does he get the helium?
Uh, but this is violating university code.
Huh. All right, do it. Tell him we’re in.
I can’t find that quote on the Internet. Did you make that up?
Aren’t you just made of sugar.
Oh, of course. An nondescript, white panel van. You may be familiar with it from the sentence, their bodies were found in a nondescript, white panel van.
I’m Skippy. Skippy Cavanaugh.
Wait, hold on, hold on. How do we know that you’re not gonna take the money and drive away?
Exactly what 1970s television crime dramas have taught us. You give us the helium first.
Guess I’m not the only one who watches ’70s television crime dramas.
Well, he is. I’m a wedding planner who can’t find love himself. It’s ironic, but the point is we can’t trust you. You’re a sketchy character in a parking garage.
Well, I never thought of it like that. Boy, frame of reference will just sneak up on you, won’t it?

Not technically. In chess, a stalemate refers to a situation in which there are no remaining moves. Uh, you have plenty of moves available. You could beat us up and steal the money. You could kill us, you know. Really, you’re only limited by your imagination.
Not necessarily. Uh, many argue the essence of a Mexican standoff is that no one can walk away from the conflict without incurring harm.

Let me give you an example. Earlier today, I decoded the headers on your e-mail, and I know that your name is Kenneth Fitzgerald. From that, I figured out where you live and where you work. Now, to make this a Mexican standoff, I would say something like, uh, you give us the helium or I’ll turn you in to the authorities.
Yeah, exactly. See, you’re getting it.
Perfect. Now we really are in a Mexican standoff. Is this one of those times where I’ve won the battle but lost the war?
I told you we shouldn’t go shopping at night.
Space-time can be interpreted as the surface of an n-dimensional superfluid.
And I’m sorry I lied about being a wedding planner who can’t find love. Although I am currently single, if you know anybody.
Did you hear that, Leonard? There’s plenty we could do about it. Do you have a card?
Right this way, Uncle Harvey.
I’m trying not to attract attention.
She said buenas noches. What was he supposed to do?
Leonard, we should probably have our story straight in case we get caught.
Well, you can’t be sure of that. What if the helium dealer rats us out? What if Kripke asks where we got it? What if the university checks my family tree and finds out I don’t have an Uncle Harvey?
Uh-oh.
Well, did you see this sticker?
It’s partially torn off, but the segment that remains reads property of and the letter U.
Yeah, but what if it’s Property of U.S. Government? There’s a national helium reserve in Amarillo, Texas. If this was stolen from there, we’re accessories to a federal crime.
That’s true. There’s the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Department of Defence, U.S. Navy, you and I are going to jail.
Anyway, if you could just give us our money back, you can have your helium and we’ll be on our way.
He has glasses and I’m a know-it-all, we are not built for prison.
You’re taking advantage of us? We clarified nomenclature together.
I don’t understand.
Well, it better not be more than a thousand dollars. That’s all I’ve got on me.
Finally, something breaks our way.
Well, the Swedes might beat us, but at least we won’t get gang-noogied in prison.
It scared me straight, Leonard.
That’s preposterous.
I don’t like being extorted like this. Especially by him of all people.
How can you trust Wikipedia if they use between to refer to three parties?
Or amongst, if they were feeling whimsically archaic.
Absolutely. But don’t be surprised if this movie sets you on the straight and narrow.
Leonard: What’s going on?
Just tell me.
Oh, well, that kind of stinks.
What are we going to do?
I’d love to, but we need liquid helium and our shipment’s on back order for a month.
That shirt brings out the blue in your eyes.
Let’s go check to see if the university has any helium in reserve.
Hey, Barry, we’re in trouble. We need liquid helium, does the department have any we can use?
Come on, Barry, there’s a Swedish team trying to run our experiment before us. Can’t you spare any?
Yes.
What are you doing?
We’d have to go to every Party City in California.
Who is he?
How does he get the helium?
Oh, hey. I just heard back from the liquid helium guy.
He’s got what we need and can meet us tonight.
The man restocking the cereal shelves.
He handed you the box directly and called you Stretch.
Do you want liquid helium or not?
Then I’m going to tell him we’re in.

We’re just bending the rules a little. We have grant money to do the experiment, so we’re going to spend it on the helium we need. It’s not like when Dr. Goldfarb claimed he bought an electron microscope and he was really just keeping a Russian girl in an apartment in Van Nuys.
Sure. So, are we doing this?
Remember? Don’t ask too many questions?
A little, but if I may quote Einstein, the pursuit of science calls us to ignore the rules set by man.
Done.
Before I answer, may I just say your skin has never looked better.
That must be him.
Hey.
Uh, I’m Leonard. This is my friend…
Uh, yeah, uh, right here.
What ya doing, Skippy?
Look, you can trust us. We’re respected scientists.
My friend does make a decent point about the money. I don’t feel comfortable just handing it over up front.
I don’t think it matters if this is a stalemate or an impasse or a Mexican standoff. What are we gonna do here?
Afraid so, Skippy.
All right, let’s all just calm down. Nobody wants to report anybody.
No, no, no. Wait, don’t go. Just let me explain. We’re physicists, and we’re trying to prove a hypothesis that we’ve been working on for over a year.
Okay, but now there’s this Swedish team that read our paper and they’re trying to beat us to our own discovery. We really need this helium.
Here’s the money. Can we do this?
It’s actually pretty common in our field. There’s not much you can do about it.
Will you stop with that already?
And tipping his hat to the cleaning lady didn’t do that?
Let’s just start the experiment.
We’re not getting caught.
The dealer doesn’t care, Kripke has no authority over us, and you being related to a metal container would explain a lot. Help me hook this up.
What?
What is it?
It’s probably USC or UCLA.
Let’s not jump to conclusions. A lot of things start with U.
Listen, we can do the experiment as planned and beat the Swedish team to the punch, or we can kiss our dreams good-bye because we were to afraid to break a few rules.
Ma’am.
Thank you for coming back.
No, nothing. We just changed our mind.
Thank you.
You know what? It’s fine. Keep the money. We just want to be done with this.
He wants more money.
Is Ernest Goes to Jail the only prison movie you’ve seen?
Thank you, Barry.
Can you give us a minute?
Me neither, but what other choice do we have?
I promise this is the last time.
It says right here on Wikipedia. A Mexican standoff is a confrontation between at least three parties.

Twue, but if it’s successful, I’m having a pawty with bawwoons.
Be honest, if the shoe was on the other foot, would you do this for me?
Hey, I’ve been thinking. I was being petty. You can have my hewium.
But you have to add my name to your paper.
I don’t know, seems fair. You can’t do it without me.
Take your time. I’ll walk out backwards for dwamatic effect.

Hey, people were still talking about that party on siete de Mayo.
What are you guys up to?
Oh, fun. Let me see. Uh, no, no, uh, definitely not.
Uh, he’s Indian. We’ve already got one of those. Ooh, we should find a nice Latino, really round us out.
You know he won’t be looking at other girls.
That’s a fair point. We wouldn’t make fun of someone like this to their face.
You may want to leave the room.
I had a great time last night.
What? I thought we were all… never mind.

Unless they’re sitting on the end of his nose.

He’s using some kind of dating app on his phone.
I don’t know. Stuart, can you come in here? He tried to explain it to me. It shows you pictures of people nearby, you swipe them around, it looks kind of like a game.
Can you show us that dating app?
Oh, what would make you give a girl a thumbs down?
Yeah, Stuart got two dates with it.
Doesn’t a teardrop tattoo mean he murdered someone?
Hey, I thought you were gonna be out late?
We put Amy on a dating app, and we’re seeing what’s out there.
Ew, check out his tiny teeth. He looks like a man-dolphin.
And I’d love to take you out again”?
Yeah, why wouldn’t you tell us?
I, I thought you weren’t ready to start seeing people.
And how many guys have you gone out with?

So is she, like, homeless, or framing him for a crime?
Oh, which one? Maybe we can get Amy to try it.
Oh, and if you lose the game, you have to go out with Stuart.
Wow. So how many girls have you met?

Oh, come on, just let him put the app on your phone.

Amy.
